security: Revealing the existence of Cover Branch and Tri-State Engineering Service, Inc as a cover, including its specific activities like marine salvage, underwater research, communications, and demolition, could compromise ongoing or future operations. The detail of Peter T. Fay being the President of the firm and the address details (address, phone, mailing location) could expose individuals and the cover company. Quoting: "Tri-State Engineering Service, Inc is located at...engaged in the general practice of engineering in all its branches with particular emphasis in the fields of..."
summary: A memorandum details an application for housing using cover employment information at Tri-State Engineering Service, Inc. to secure credit references.
summary_one_paragraph: On September 20, 1966, a memorandum outlines an individual's application for housing at 646 S.W. 29 St., facilitated through Roso Realty, using Tri-State Engineering Service, Inc. as a cover for credit references. The applicant, seeking to secure a loan via VA or FHA plans, provided falsified employment details, including a stated salary of $120 a week as an electronic technician. The memo emphasizes the necessity of using Tri-State due to the inapplicability of RECE for credit references, noting Tri-State's willingness to cooperate in verifying the provided employment information.
title: Housing Application Using Cover Employment
